title: (x) rounded geometric sans from Joji Inc - Bryant {Geoff}
content:
Hello girls and guys,

i'm new there, and i've been told by a friend about this website that is really great.

My first post is identifying a font that i don't find anywhere.

I'm working for a client, and unfortunately, i've to edit some text but haven't any source to identify this font, so the only i have is jpg image.

so the ultimate question is, what font is iT? :)

it would be wonderful if anyone found it out...

Thank you in advance for your help

victor

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [joji\_logo1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114171855/http:/typophile.com/files/joji_logo1.jpg) | 28.93 KB |
| [Untitled-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114171855/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_11.jpg) | 26.95 KB |
author: victorm

comments.content: Hi Victor, I think it's [Bryant Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114171855/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=PRC.123370.0.0), it looks slightly [squooshed](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114171855/http:/typophile.com/wiki/squooshed) as well.

thank you very much!  
i'm not sure it's the same one, 'cause some shapes are slightly different, but it will work as well, i guess the client will not see the difference, let's hope that :)

hello, i've been told the exact font, it's called Technic Bold

the only page where i've seen it is there:  
 [http://www.flyerstarter.com/Free-Fonts/T/Technic-Bold.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114171855/http:/www.flyerstarter.com/Free-Fonts/T/Technic-Bold.html "http://www.flyerstarter.com/Free-Fonts/T/Technic-Bold.html")

That'd explain the squooshed-ness, assuming it looks like that out of the box and I think it does. Well, it doesn't seem to be free, apparently you can buy it [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114171855/http:/www.linguistsoftware.com/tech.htm) as part of a bundle for US $99.95.

I wouldn't recommend buying this, I think you should replace it with Eric Olson's [Bryant Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114171855/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryantcon/index.html), it costs $99.00 for 4 weights. You'd save 95 cents and gain a lowercase as a bonus. :^D
